partintro.para: The functions in this extension implement client access to file servers speaking the File Transfer Protocol FTP as defined in &spec.ftp;.
The following constants are defined when using the FTP module: FTP_ASCII and FTP_BINARY.
In order to use FTP functions with your PHP configuration, you should add the --enable-ftp option when installing PHP 4, and --with-ftp when using PHP 3.

example.title: ftp example
example.programlisting:
<?php
// set up basic connection
$conn_id = ftp_connect($ftp_server); 

// login with username and password
$login_result = ftp_login($conn_id, $ftp_user_name, $ftp_user_pass); 

// check connection
if ((!$conn_id) || (!$login_result)) { 
        echo "Ftp connection has failed!";
        echo "Attempted to connect to $ftp_server for user $ftp_user_name"; 
        die; 
    } else {
        echo "Connected to $ftp_server, for user $ftp_user_name";
    }

// upload the file
$upload = ftp_put($conn_id, $destination_file, $source_file, FTP_BINARY); 

// check upload status
if (!$upload) { 
        echo "Ftp upload has failed!";
    } else {
        echo "Uploaded $source_file to $ftp_server as $destination_file";
    }

// close the FTP stream 
ftp_quit($conn_id); 
?>

refnamediv.refpurpose: Opens up an FTP connection

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns a FTP stream on success, &false; on error.
ftp_connect opens up a FTP connection to the specified host. The port parameter specifies an alternate port to connect to. If it is omitted or zero, then the default FTP port, 21, will be used.

The timeout parameter specifies the timeout for all subsequent network operations. If ommited, the default value is 90 seconds. The timeout can be changed and queried anytime with ftp_set_option and ftp_get_option.
This is parameter is only available in CVS.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Logs in the given FTP stream.
Returns &true; on success, &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns a list of files in the given directory.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns an array of filenames from the specified directory on success, &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns a detailed list of files in the given directory.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_rawlist executes the FTP LIST command, and returns the result as an array. Each array element corresponds to one line of text. The output is not parsed in any way. The system type identifier returned by ftp_systype can be used to determine how the results should be interpreted.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the system type identifier of the remote FTP server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns the remote system type, or &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Turns passive mode on or off.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_pasv turns on passive mode if the pasv parameter is &true; (it turns off passive mode if pasv is &false;.) In passive mode, data connections are initiated by the client, rather than by the server.
Returns &true; on success, &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Downloads a file from the FTP server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_get retrieves remote_file from the FTP server, and saves it to local_file locally. The transfer mode specified must be either FTP_ASCII or FTP_BINARY.
Returns &true; on success, &false; on error.
See also ftp_fget.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Downloads a file from the FTP server and saves to an open file.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_fget retrieves remote_file from the FTP server, and writes it to the given file pointer, fp. The transfer mode specified must be either FTP_ASCII or FTP_BINARY.
Returns &true; on success, &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Uploads a file to the FTP server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_put stores local_file on the FTP server, as remote_file. The transfer mode specified must be either FTP_ASCII or FTP_BINARY.
Returns &true; on success, &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Uploads from an open file to the FTP server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_fput uploads the data from the file pointer fp until end of file. The results are stored in remote_file on the FTP server. The transfer mode specified must be either FTP_ASCII or FTP_BINARY
Returns &true; on success, &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the size of the given file.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_size returns the size of a file. If an error occurs, of if the file does not exist, -1 is returned. Not all servers support this feature.
Returns the file size on success, or -1 on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the last modified time of the given file.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_mdtm checks the last-modified time for a file, and returns it as a UNIX timestamp. If an error occurs, or the file does not exist, -1 is returned. Note that not all servers support this feature.
Returns a UNIX timestamp on success, or -1 on error.

note.para: ftp_mdtm does not work with directories.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Renames a file on the ftp server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_rename renames the file or directory currently named from to the new name to, on the FTP stream ftp_stream.
Returns &true; on success, &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Deletes a file on the ftp server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_delete deletes the file specified by path from the FTP server.
Returns &true; on success, &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sends a SITE command to the server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_site sends the command specified by cmd to the FTP server. SITE commands are not standardized, and vary from server to server. They are useful for handling such things as file permissions and group membership.
Returns &true; on success, &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Closes an FTP connection

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_quit closes ftp_stream.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Set miscellaneous runtime FTP options.

refsect1.title: Description

note.para: This function is only available in CVS.

refsect1.para: Returns &true; if the option could be set; &false; if not. A warning message will be thrown if the option is not supported or the passed value doesn't match the expected value for the given option.

This function controls various runtime options for the specified FTP stream. The value parameter depends on which option parameter is choosen to be altered. Currently, the following options are supported:
Supported runtime FTP options
FTP_TIMEOUT_SEC Changes the timeout in seconds used for all network related functions. Parameter value has be to of type int and must be greater than 0. The default timeout is 90 seconds.

example.title: ftp_set_option example
example.programlisting: // Set the network timeout down to 10 seconds ftp_set_option($conn_id, FTP_TIMEOUT_SEC, 10);

refnamediv.refpurpose: Retrieves various runtime behaviours of the current FTP stream.

refsect1.title: Description

note.para: This function is only available in CVS.

refsect1.para: Returns the value on success or &false; if the given option is not supposed. In the latter case a warning message is also thrown.

This function returns the value for the requested option from the specified FTP stream. Currently, the following options are supported:
Supported runtime FTP options
FTP_TIMEOUT_SEC Returns the current timeout used for network related operations.

example.title: ftp_get_option example
example.programlisting: // Get the timeout of the given FTP stream $timeout = ftp_get_option($conn_id, FTP_TIMEOUT_SEC);
